newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: WG&A sees no impact from sunken ship.
newsitem.headline: WG&A sees no impact from sunken ship.

text.p: Shipping firm WG&A said on Tuesday that one of its luxury ships caught fire and sank last week, but that the loss will not hurt its finances.
In an advisory to the Philippine Stock Exchange, WG&A president Bob Gothong said that the vessel, which sank last Wednesday, is fully covered by insurance.
"Under this circumstances, we wish to assure everyone that this unhappy event will not in any manner adversely affect the financial conditions of the company," Gothong said.
Gothong added that no passengers were on board when the fire broke out last Wednesday as the ship was docked and preparing for its next voyage. He did not state the cause of the fire.
WG&A shares traded lower in late Tuesday trade by 50 centavos, or 17.24 percent to 2.40 pesos on a total of 1.89 million shares.
"It's one of the best ships they have so its not so easy to say that it will not affect operations," said Lawrence de Leon, analyst at Dharmala Securities Phils.

"It was touted as one of the most modern to sail the Philippine shores. The incident just awakened apprehensions about the shipping industry," said April Bautista, analyst at Anscor Hagedorn Securities.
